Straight Shot nodds.

"Yes sir, we'll do what we can... Aw maan, fine time =
to be without Tucson..

Quickstride looks to her.

"Hey, I'll be okay for a=
 while, why don't you go check up on your brother?"

She nodds.

"Thank you=
 Quickstride, I'll take Elita with me."

She now walks into the stasis area=
, where Tucson had gone to rest.  He looked quite peaceful laying there, ye=
t, he appeared to be stirring somewhat. 

"Wait a minute, he's stirring, th=
at means he's coming around.  That can't be, he's supposed to rest for a lo=
nger period of time than that.  What the pit's bringing him out of... I bet=
 he didn't turn off his com link, that's what.  C'mon Elita, we better go s=
ee why your Uncle Tucson is cutting his stasis time a little short."

Tucso=
n opens his eyes, and with a quiet sigh, he sits up on the table.
Straight =
Shot eyes him and clears her throat.

"Ahem!  You do realize you have not r=
ested for the ample amount of time it takes to repair your systems right?"
=

He nodds.

" I know.  And you're right, I left my com link on.  I'm all ri=
ght though, I think I've rested for a reasonable amount of time, just enoug=
h to get through our next crisis.  With most of our comrades in stasis, Rod=
imus is going to need substantial assistance"

He now gets on his feet.  St=
raight Shot tries to stop him.

"Wait, maybe it's not such a hot idea.  You=
 need your rest."

Tucson smiles.

"I'll be fine, really.  Is that Elita wi=
th you? I can hear her."

Straight Shot chuckles.

"Nothing gets past your =
audio sensors.  It sure is.  Lemme guess, you wanna hold her right?"

He no=
dds.  And is soon given Elita as he holds her gently in his own arms.  Stra=
ight Shot smiles as he holds her.  He sits back down with Straight Shot.

"=
You know, I think you and Talon would make excellent parents."

Tucson smil=
es as he gets up again, and slowly walks out of the room with Straight Shot=
 beside him, holding Elita in his arms. 

" We'll see about that..  Right n=
ow I think she would really like to see her father.  Uncle Tucson can't tak=
e all the attention away from your dad."

He gently rubs her head, and ente=
rs the room where Rodimus is.

" I know what you'll tell me, and you're rig=
ht, I shouldn't be out of stasis just yet, but, I couldn't help thinking ab=
out what would happen if I wasn't there to lend you support.  Oh, and I tho=
ught you might want to say hello to Elita."

He smiles as he holds her clos=
e to Rodimus, waiting for him to hold her.
